page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: This has, until recently, been an entirely agricultural area and some residents are still employed on farms here or nearby. But, the coming of the railways and, later, of trunk roads such as A3 and M25, has led to an almost overwhelming influx of commuters. They travel to London, to Heathrow Airport, to Woking or to aircraft works in Weybridge or as salesmen all over the country. The 25 shops in Ripley include several selling antiques, for which the place is noted. There is also a hairdresser, an estate agent and the garages and pubs etc listed in the Amenity Count.
